description: From Latin delectus (“selection”), from deligo (“to select”).

entries.meaning: (obsolete) An elementary reader (collection of passages) for learners of a language
examples: If she spoke with any keenness of interest to Mr. Casaubon, he heard her with an air of patience as if she had given a quotation from the Delectus familiar to him from his tender years, and sometimes mentioned curtly what ancient sects or personages had held similar ideas, as if there were too much of that sort in stock already; at other times he would inform her that she was mistaken, and reassert what her remark had questioned.
